pull.title: ci: Move remained task from Cirrus to GitHub Actions
pull.body: This PR concludes the migration from Cirrus CI to GitHub Actions.

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

verification.payload:
tree f18e310fd0699f569f2458baa751abcced0d2ce9
parent fb4085a64c3c6bd30498d4a6a0e89f66d22c4824
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1692712522 +0100
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1692730850 +0100

ci: Move "C++ (public headers)" from Cirrus to GitHub Actions

events.message: ci: Move "C++ (public headers)" from Cirrus to GitHub Actions

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -373,6 +373,138 @@ jobs:
         run: env
         if: ${{ always() }}
 
+  sanitizers_debian:
+    name: ${{ matrix.configuration.job_name }}
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    needs: docker_cache
+
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false
+      matrix:
+        configuration:
+          - job_name: 'Valgrind (memcheck)'
+            env_vars:
+              # The `--error-exitcode` is required to make the test fail if valgrind found errors,
+              # otherwise it will return 0 (https://www.valgrind.org/docs/manual/manual-core.html).
+              WRAPPER_CMD: 'valgrind --error-exitcode=42'
+              SECP256K1_TEST_ITERS: 2
+          - job_name: 'UBSan, ASan, LSan'
+            env_vars:
+              CFLAGS: '-fsanitize=undefined,address -g'
+              UBSAN_OPTIONS: 'print_stacktrace=1:halt_on_error=1'
+              ASAN_OPTIONS: 'strict_string_checks=1:detect_stack_use_after_return=1:detect_leaks=1'
+              LSAN_OPTIONS: 'use_unaligned=1'
+              SECP256K1_TEST_ITERS: 32
+        asm:
+          - env_vars: { ASM: 'auto' }
+          - env_vars: { ASM: 'no', ECMULTGENPRECISION: 2, ECMULTWINDOW: 2 }
+        cc:
+          - env_vars: { CC: 'clang' }
+          - env_vars: { HOST: 'i686-linux-gnu', CC: 'i686-linux-gnu-gcc' }
+
+    env:
+      ECDH: 'yes'
+      RECOVERY: 'yes'
+      SCHNORRSIG: 'yes'
+      ELLSWIFT: 'yes'
+      CTIMETESTS: 'no'
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+
+      - name: Set environment variables
+        run: |
+          for var in "$(jq -s 'add' <<< '${{ toJSON(matrix.configuration.env_vars) }} ${{ toJSON(matrix.asm.env_vars) }} ${{ toJSON(matrix.cc.env_vars) }}' | jq -r 'to_entries | .[] | "\(.key)=\(.value)"')"; do
+            echo "$var" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
+          done          
+
+      - name: CI script
+        uses: ./.github/actions/run-in-docker-action
+        with:
+          dockerfile: ./ci/linux-debian.Dockerfile
+          tag: linux-debian-image
+          command: >
+            git config --global --add safe.directory ${{ github.workspace }} &&
+            ./ci/ci.sh
+
+      - run: cat tests.log || true
+        if: ${{ always() }}
+      - run: cat noverify_tests.log || true
+        if: ${{ always() }}
+      - run: cat exhaustive_tests.log || true
+        if: ${{ always() }}
+      - run: cat ctime_tests.log || true
+        if: ${{ always() }}
+      - run: cat bench.log || true
+        if: ${{ always() }}
+      - run: cat config.log || true
+        if: ${{ always() }}
+      - run: cat test_env.log || true
+        if: ${{ always() }}
+      - name: CI env
+        run: env
+        if: ${{ always() }}
+
+  msan_debian:
+    name: "MSan"
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    needs: docker_cache
+
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false
+      matrix:
+        configuration:
+          - env_vars:
+              CFLAGS: '-fsanitize=memory -g'
+          - env_vars:
+              ECMULTGENPRECISION: 2
+              ECMULTWINDOW: 2
+              CFLAGS: '-fsanitize=memory -g -O3'
+
+    env:
+      ECDH: 'yes'
+      RECOVERY: 'yes'
+      SCHNORRSIG: 'yes'
+      ELLSWIFT: 'yes'
+      CTIMETESTS: 'yes'
+      CC: 'clang'
+      SECP256K1_TEST_ITERS: 32
+      ASM: 'no'
+      WITH_VALGRIND: 'no'
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+
+      - name: CI script
+        env: ${{ matrix.configuration.env_vars }}
+        uses: ./.github/actions/run-in-docker-action
+        with:
+          dockerfile: ./ci/linux-debian.Dockerfile
+          tag: linux-debian-image
+          command: >
+            git config --global --add safe.directory ${{ github.workspace }} &&
comments.body:
Not this PR, but now that I see this, couldn't we add this to `run-in-docker-action` to avoid duplication?

(did I ask this before?)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -373,6 +373,138 @@ jobs:
         run: env
         if: ${{ always() }}
 
+  sanitizers_debian:
+    name: ${{ matrix.configuration.job_name }}
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    needs: docker_cache
+
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false
+      matrix:
+        configuration:
+          - job_name: 'Valgrind (memcheck)'
+            env_vars:
+              # The `--error-exitcode` is required to make the test fail if valgrind found errors,
+              # otherwise it will return 0 (https://www.valgrind.org/docs/manual/manual-core.html).
+              WRAPPER_CMD: 'valgrind --error-exitcode=42'
+              SECP256K1_TEST_ITERS: 2
+          - job_name: 'UBSan, ASan, LSan'
+            env_vars:
+              CFLAGS: '-fsanitize=undefined,address -g'
+              UBSAN_OPTIONS: 'print_stacktrace=1:halt_on_error=1'
+              ASAN_OPTIONS: 'strict_string_checks=1:detect_stack_use_after_return=1:detect_leaks=1'
+              LSAN_OPTIONS: 'use_unaligned=1'
+              SECP256K1_TEST_ITERS: 32
+        asm:
+          - env_vars: { ASM: 'auto' }
+          - env_vars: { ASM: 'no', ECMULTGENPRECISION: 2, ECMULTWINDOW: 2 }
+        cc:
+          - env_vars: { CC: 'clang' }
+          - env_vars: { HOST: 'i686-linux-gnu', CC: 'i686-linux-gnu-gcc' }
+
+    env:
+      ECDH: 'yes'
+      RECOVERY: 'yes'
+      SCHNORRSIG: 'yes'
+      ELLSWIFT: 'yes'
+      CTIMETESTS: 'no'
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+
+      - name: Set environment variables
+        run: |
+          for var in "$(jq -s 'add' <<< '${{ toJSON(matrix.configuration.env_vars) }} ${{ toJSON(matrix.asm.env_vars) }} ${{ toJSON(matrix.cc.env_vars) }}' | jq -r 'to_entries | .[] | "\(.key)=\(.value)"')"; do
+            echo "$var" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
+          done
comments.body:
A bit ugly, hm... There's no better way to merge this, I guess.

I think it makes sense to split this job into two jobs "Valgrind (memcheck)" and "UBSan, ASan, LSan". Then for each of these jobs, we can expand the remaining 2x2 combinations, i.e., list the 4 resulting combinations explicitly. This is probably a good idea anyway, it will also make it a bit easier to add variety to the jobs.

What do you think?

comments.body:
> I think it makes sense to split this job into two jobs "Valgrind (memcheck)" and "UBSan, ASan, LSan".

I was thinking about the same. But it won't help.

Only one `env` property is allowed job-wide and step-wide. Job-wide `env` is already busy with global variables. Therefore, even 2 sets won't fit one step-wide `env`.

comments.body:
> (did I ask this before?)

We discussed whether it should be placed in `ci.sh`.

UPD. ... as it's done in bitcoin repo.
